node.title: COVID outbreak in Bangladesh squad almost forced cancellation of NZ cricket tour
node.description: The squad were finally allowed to train on Tuesday, after being cleared to leave MIQ.
node.content: ["Bangladesh cricket coach Russell Domingo has admitted his side almost pulled out of the upcoming test series against the Blackcaps after some of the touring party had to extend their time in quarantine.", "The team's spin coach tested positive for COVID-19, while eight players and staff were deemed close contacts of a positive case on their flight to New Zealand.", "The squad were finally allowed to train on Tuesday, after being cleared to leave MIQ and practice together as a team for the first time.\u00a0", "\"It was like Christmas came early,\" says coach Russell Domingo.", "It's been a week of uncertainty for the tourists after spin bowling coach Rangana Herath tested positive for COVID and if it had spread further, it's unlikely the two test series would've gone ahead.", "\"There's no doubt if someone was positive and there were close contacts, I reckon [the series] would have been [called off].\"", "And although it was all smiles at training on Tuesday, the COVID outbreak has\u00a0 taken its toll, after forcing the team to stay confined to their hotel rooms.", "\"It was seven days quarantine, then it was nine days, then it was 12 - so it was a bit tough,\" says fast bowler Taskin Ahmed.", "It's been even tougher on their spin coach, who now won't be able to join the squad before the first test on New Year's Day.", "\"He's the nicest man in the world,\" says Domingo.", "\"He's got to spend another 10 days in his room by himself, which means in total he'll spend nearly a month in isolation.\"", "COVID's put everyone in a spin, including Bangladesh, who now have just 11 days to prepare for the first test against New Zealand."]
